Charisse Hao

chao@ucsd.edu
Charisse made extensive contributions to the technical, analytical, and creative aspects of the project. She developed Prompt 1, cleaned and parsed the data for analysis, and created reusable functions for future research. Additionally, Charisse selected the LLMs to test, designed the analysis plan, and automated a function that checks assumptions using Shapiro-Wilk and Levene’s tests, then runs the appropriate statistical methods, such as Kruskal-Wallis and Dunn’s tests. Beyond the analysis, Charisse designed the project poster, developed functions for visualizing results, contributed to the website, and drafted key sections of the report, including the Abstract, Models, Data Cleaning and Exploratory Data Analysis, Prompt 1 Results, and Generalizability, Limitations, and Future Work.

Lana Murray

lmurray@ucsd.edu
Lana played a key role in conceptualizing the project and defining its research goals. They led the development of the research agenda, formulated research questions, and secured resources. During the initial phase, Lana contacted housing sector professionals, created interview questions, and facilitated interviews that provided valuable insights. They also collaborated with Jenna on developing and analyzing Prompt 2 results. Additionally, Lana took the lead in writing, contributing to sections including the Introduction, Prior Literature, Interviews, Prompt Generation and Submission, Statistical Techniques, Prompt 2 Results, Generalizability, Limitations, Future Work, and the Conclusion.

Jenna Canicosa

jcanicosa@ucsd.edu
Jenna contributed to both the qualitative and quantitative aspects of the project. She created student interview questions, synthesized responses, and helped develop and analyze Prompt 2. Additionally, she assisted in designing the initial version of the website. Jenna also contributed to writing, focusing on the Prompt 2 Results, Discussion, and Summary and Interpretation of Results sections.

Joseph Guzman

j4guzman@ucsd.edu
Joseph developed the base code for the website, designing interactive elements for data visualization and exploring web hosting methods using Web-based SSH Consoles, GitHub Pages, Flask, and FastAPI. He also assisted the team as needed and contributed to writing the Discussion, Summary and Interpretation of Results, and Conclusion sections.

Prof. Stuart Geiger (Mentor)

sgeiger@ucsd.edu
Stuart served as the project mentor, providing guidance, oversight, and ensuring alignment with research objectives.
